Name: Model of Woman Reclining on a Bed with Headrest
Description: Many speculations had been suggested regarding how the ancient Egyptians slept upon beds using a headrest of wood, ivory or faience. Scenes of servants preparing the beds were shown on wall reliefs and paintings from different periods. However, the beds were covered with a sheet or mattress. The most interesting testimony for the use of the headrest in sleeping is found in the model of a miniature bed of painted limestone showing a woman's statue reclining on its side and using a headrest.
